creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: surrealist landscape with blue vertical forked spires and yellow, green, and grey circles; oval cluster of light spots ULQ resembles a cloud; rust colored horizon across lower quadrant; brown foreground with light spots at bottom
inscription: Bottom, in pencil (artist\'s name in ink): [Toward the Sky] [52/100] [Toshi Yoshida] [1965]
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Toward the Sky
